metadata.description: High school admissions evaluation criteria - v2 sophisticated assessment
metadata.critical_context: These are 13-14 year olds (8th graders). More maturity expected than middle school, but still developing. Balance between authentic teenage voice and emerging sophistication.

evaluation_philosophy.core_principle: At this age, schools want to see emerging maturity, genuine passion, and academic readiness for rigorous coursework. The applicant should sound like a thoughtful 14-year-old, not a mini-adult.
what_matters_most: Strong academic preparation and intellectual curiosity
Clear fit with target school's culture

harker.name: Harker School
what_they_seek: Strong STEM or arts programs interest
Well-rounded with depth in key areas

academic_expectations.testing: ISEE Upper Level - high scores expected
academic_expectations.rigor: Should be in advanced/accelerated classes if available

harker.special_notes: One of the most competitive private high schools in the Bay Area. Strong robotics, CS, and athletics.

bellarmine.name: Bellarmine College Preparatory
bellarmine.special_notes: Jesuit values of service are crucial. Shadow day/interview important.

menlo.name: Menlo School
menlo.special_notes: Video responses (Kira) are part of evaluation. Looking for genuine personality.

crystal_springs.name: Crystal Springs Uplands
crystal_springs.special_notes: Small, close-knit community. Interview matters significantly.

lick_wilmerding.name: Lick-Wilmerding High School
lick_wilmerding.special_notes: Unique shop/technical arts program. Looking for makers and builders.

criteria: Taking advanced courses in areas of strength
Test scores below typical range for target schools
May struggle with competitive school workload
Authentic teenage voice (sounds like a mature 14-year-old)
Mix of specific and generic content
State/regional level recognition in primary activity
Genuine interest in at least one area

high_priority.name: Too Many Activities Without Depth
high_priority.description: List of 8+ activities with 1-2 years each
high_priority.counselor_explanation: This activity list shows breadth but not depth. Competitive high schools want to see sustained commitment and achievement in a few areas, not surface-level involvement in many. Quality over quantity.

high_priority.name: Essay Doesn't Sound Like a 14-Year-Old
high_priority.description: Writing is too polished or sophisticated
high_priority.counselor_explanation: This essay doesn't sound like an 8th grader wrote it. Admissions officers can detect heavy parent or consultant editing. A genuine teenage voice with some imperfections is better than a polished essay that sounds inauthentic.

high_priority.name: Generic 'Why This School' Essay
high_priority.description: Could apply to any school with name change
high_priority.counselor_explanation: The 'Why This School' essay doesn't demonstrate real research or specific fit. Schools want to see that you understand what makes them unique and why you specifically belong there.

high_priority.name: No Coherent Story Across Application
high_priority.description: Activities, essays, and interests don't connect
high_priority.counselor_explanation: The different parts of this application don't tell a coherent story. Activities point in one direction, essays in another. Admissions officers look for a clear through-line that shows who this student is.

medium_priority.name: Academic Profile Below Target School Average
medium_priority.description: GPA or test scores below typical admitted student
medium_priority.counselor_explanation: The academic profile is below the typical range for admitted students at competitive private high schools. Strong academics are a baseline expectation.

medium_priority.name: No Evidence of Leadership or Initiative
medium_priority.counselor_explanation: The activity list shows participation but no leadership or initiative. By 8th grade, competitive applicants typically have at least one leadership role or self-started project.

the_stem_leader.description: Strong in STEM with robotics, math competitions, or science projects

the_scholar_athlete.description: Balances strong academics with athletic excellence

the_community_builder.description: Focus on service, leadership, and helping others
